item.title: Report E-2025030232
item.description:
Report E-2025030232

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-17
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 17, 2025, one (1) 345-gallon tote of UN1897 had its support leg damaged and released approximately 0.25-gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the spent product and containerized them in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew also patched the damaged tote and staged it onsite pending a new tote for a transfer.

item.title: Report X-2025030932
item.description:
Report X-2025030932

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: BALDWIN PARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No comments provided. Multiple X-2025030934 ONE OF THREE SIMILAR BOXES THAT CAME DOWN THE IRREGULARS BELT. ALL THREE HAD SOIL STAINS SO DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED. BOXES RETURNED TO DMP WHERE THEY WERE INSPECTED. THIS HAD SMALL CRACKS Multiple X-2025030935 BOX WAS VISIBLY SOILED AND BELT WAS STOPPED UNTIL DESIGNATED RESPONDER CAME. BOX WAS TAKEN TO THE DMP TO INSPECT FURTHER WHEN A SMALL CRACK WAS FOUND.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The train crew reported an odor coming from or near the CBTX 737968. American Integrated Services was sent to investigate and remediate any findings. When they climbed on top of the car, they reported that an odor was detectable. Their inspection found four loose manway swing bolts. AIS tightened the swing bolts stopping the release.

item.title: Report X-2025030848
item.description:
Report X-2025030848

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-28
  • City: REDDING
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/27/2025 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 527433 at the station location in Redding, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of unknown medical drugs packed with dry ice. The package was retrieved from the drop box, where the courier noticed the package was very cold to the touch. The security team opened the shipment and confirmed suspicions of the usage of dry ice. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, and packaging. The package was surrendered to the security team.

item.title: Report E-2025030244
item.description:
Report E-2025030244

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-22T21:13:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-19
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0250 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal USA. It was reported that approximately 1-cup of "Stratum Ultra Urethane Primer" released from a plastic pail due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #3213520. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO will place the waste inside of a 10-gallon metal drum.

It was reported that approximately 1) 5-gallon jerry can of Alpet D2 Quart-free sanitizer released from jerrican due to xk. The release impacted trailer # 4651078. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used a 20-gallon metal drum for the waste.
